Getting started

  1. Unzip your download, the-tooltip-3.0.zip.
  2. Place the contents of the the-tooltip-3.0 folder in your local or remote project folder.
  3. Follow the steps under integration.

Included

Path Description
css/the-tooltip.css CSS stylesheet
demo/the-tooltip.html Demo
demo/images Images used in the demo
demo/js JavaScript used in the demo
documentaton/documentation.html Documentation
js/selectivizr-min.js Selectivizr (bringing support for IE7 and IE8)
js/the-tooltip.js Support for touch devices
js/the-tooltip.min.js Support for touch devices, minified
less/the-tooltip.less LESS stylesheet

Integration

Open the HTML document you want to integrate The Tooltip in.

Include the stylesheet

<link href="css/the-tooltip.css" rel="stylesheet" />

Paste the above code within the head tags.

Include the JavaScript file

<script defer src="js/the-tooltip.min.js"></script>

Paste the above code before the body closing tag.

Include Selectivizr

<!--[if (gte IE 6)&(lte IE 8)]>
<script defer src="//s3.amazonaws.com/nwapi/nwmatcher/nwmatcher-1.2.4-min.js"></script>
<script defer src="js/selectivizr-min.js"></script>
<![endif]-->

Paste the above code before the body closing tag.

Selectivizr requires the inclusion of one of the JavaScript libraries listed on its website. If you are using any of those already, you can leave out the NWMatcher script.

Changing the JavaScript selector

  1. Open the-tooltip.js.
  2. Go to the last line.
  3. Change .the-tooltip to your preferred selector, e.g. #id, .classname, tagname.

FAQ

Why is part of The Tooltip hidden?

If the parent element has overflow: hidden; set, The Tooltip is cut off if it overflows the edges of this element.

Can I make the background transparent?

Short answer: no.
With advanced customization, involving CSS gradients, you can make the background transparent so that it also fits with The Tooltip's pointer.

Changing the CSS selector

The default selector for The Tooltip is .the-tooltip. You may want to change this.

  1. Open the-tooltip.css.
  2. Do a search and replace with as search value .the-tooltip and replace value your preferred selector, e.g. #id, .classname, tagname.
  3. Change the JavaScript selector to match your chosen selector.

Customizations

A few pointers:

  • If you want to completely customize The Tooltip, go to Building a custom tooltip.
  • Make sure that the customizations are included after the-tooltip.css.

General

You can customize The Tooltip via CSS, like so:

.the-tooltip > :last-child {
font-size: 15px;
font-weight: bold;
text-align: center;
}

Hiding the pointer

.the-tooltip > :last-child:after,
.the-tooltip > :last-child:before {
border-width: 0;
}

API

Mixins

auto-width

.auto-width;

Adjusts to the width of its content.

Auto width is not compatible with position center.

bottom

.bottom;

Vertical position bottom.

center

.center;

Horizontal position center.

color-scheme

.color-scheme(@base-color, @color-percentage: 50%, @border-color-percentage: 15%);

Apply a color scheme.

@base-color
A hexadecimal color value used as the base color for the text color and border color.
@color-percentage
The contrast between the text color and the base color. 100% represents black and -100% white.
@border-color-percentage
The contrast between the border color and the base color.

full-width

.full-width;

Adjusts to the width of its parent.

left

.left;

Horizontal position left.

right

.right;

Horizontal position right.

text-shadow

.text-shadow(@color, @alpha);

Set a text shadow.

@color
A hexadecimal color value.
@alpha
The alpha level of the text shadow color.

top

.top;

Vertical position top.

Options

Because of the way LESS works, options apply only if they are set in the-tooltip.less.

border-radius

@border-radius: 5px;

border-width

@border-width: 1px;

font-size

@font-size: 17px;

The font size for text inside The Tooltip. Set to inherit to leave this up to the parent element.

margin

@margin: 5px;

padding

@padding: 10px 20px;

pointer-margin

@pointer-margin: 20px;

The margin between the pointer and the left and right side of The Tooltip.

pointer-width

@pointer-width: 10px;

Set to 0 if you want to hide the pointer completely.

transition-in-delay

@transition-in-delay: 0s;

The delay in seconds before The Tooltip fades in.

transition-out-delay

@transition-out-delay: 0s;

The delay in seconds before The Tooltip fades out.

width

@width: 250px;

The width of The Tooltip. This is the outer width, so padding and borders will be subtracted from it.

Usage in a LESS stylesheet

Importing

To start using the mixins, you first need to import the-tooltip.less:

@import url('the-tooltip.less');

Mixin in

#the-tooltip > .mixin;

The mixin is preceded by The Tooltip's namespace, #the-tooltip.
Replace mixin with the name of the mixin you want to call.

Example

@import url('the-tooltip.less');


nav a {
padding: 10px 20px;
text-decoration: none;
text-transform: uppercase;

	#the-tooltip > .core;
	#the-tooltip > .bottom;
	#the-tooltip > .center;
	#the-tooltip > .apple-green;
}

Building a custom tooltip

Building a custom tooltip has some advantages over using the-tooltip.css:

  • Smaller file size.
  • You don't need to apply a collection of classnames like top left full-width apple-green.
  • Custom color schemes.
  • Options like border radius, padding, pointer width, etc. which you can adjust to better align The Tooltip with the design of your project.

These are the steps you can follow to generate a custom tooltip:

  1. Go to dadu.be/less-css.
  2. Drag and drop the-tooltip.less into that web page.
  3. Change the selector, #the-tooltip to your preferred selector, e.g. .tooltip. Also change the JavaScript selector to match your chosen selector.
  4. Adjust any options you would like to adjust.
  5. Mixin the core by typing .core; on a new line.
  6. Mixin a vertical and horizontal position, e.g. .top; .left;.
  7. Mixin a color scheme, e.g. .apple-green;.
    Or create your own color scheme, e.g. .color-scheme(#D1E231, 40%);.
  8. Copy the generated CSS code and paste it in your stylesheet.
